headline: Warm Waters Help Push Irene North
summary: A southerly dip in a jet stream on the U.S. mainland and warmer-than-usual water temperatures in the Atlantic Ocean are helping push Hurricane Irene farther north along the Eastern seaboard than most tropical storms, say meteorologists.

headline: Japan's Consumer Prices Rise
summary: Japan's core consumer-price index rose 0.1% in July from a year earlier, higher than the median forecast for a 0.1% drop.

headline: U.S. Stocks End Streak
summary: U.S. stocks dropped Thursday after three days of sharp gains as Warren Buffett's $5 billion investment in Bank of America failed to stoke investors' appetite for risk ahead of Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke's speech on Friday.

summary: Exchanges laid out plans to cope with the high winds and heavy rain expected as Hurricane Irene moves northward.

summary: CME Group cut the collateral that traders must put up to trade its main crude-oil futures contract Thursday, a move the exchange operator attributed to a drop in volatility.

summary: As many as three Mexican states are likely to set bond offerings backed by government development bank Banobras as a handful of local governments rush to refinance short-term debt for longer maturities.

summary: Groupon is considering opening an international headquarters in Switzerland, in a move that could benefit the daily-deal company because of the country's business-friendly tax policies.

summary: Apple's stock is widely held not only by individuals, but also by mutual funds -- tech funds, growth funds and those that track the S&P 500.

summary: Oil prices turned around to close higher, dragged up by soaring gasoline futures. Forecasts for Hurricane Irene to hit the East Coast have sparked worries that fuel supplies in the area could be disrupted.

summary: India's economic growth may slow further because of the recent global troubles and the government may miss its budget deficit target, making the task of controlling inflation more difficult, the central bank said.

summary: German Chancellor Angela Merkel has canceled a trip to Russia in early September to shepherd through passage of a change to the euro zone's bailout fund.

summary: Cipla, one of India's top generic drug makers by sales, is open to entering marketing alliances with international drug companies for tapping the opportunity in emerging markets.

headline: Most French Oppose DSK Returning to Politics Soon

headline: Hyatt Cuts Back on LodgeWorks Purchase
summary: Hyatt Hotels has scaled back its purchase of several extended-stay hotels from LodgeWorks to 20 from 24 and lowering the price to $661 million from $802 million.

headline: Impala Platinum Sees Rising Costs

summary: Pricing airline tickets is much like a rug bazaar, where the airlines try to get as much as they can out of each passenger.

summary: The Alameda Point Antiques Faire attracts thousands of visitors every month, led by the growing popularity of collectibles and midcentury style.

summary: This easy-to-navigate city in northern France has Medieval charm, good hotels and friendly locals.

headline: Time for Concern, Not Panic, Over EU Banks

summary: Taking U.S.-listed Chinese companies private is the latest bad idea to sweep the private-equity world.

summary: Turning relics into fine lodgings isn't new, but a new wave of oddball hotels in Europe displays whimsy more expected of American kitsch meccas.
